text:
Hey guys it's Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today we're gonna be making something I got
so many requests for!
We are gonna be making something Catbug!

Catbug is an adorable character from the series
Bravest Warriors.

I'll put a link down below, so if you haven't
seen it before, go check it out, it is an

adorable cartoon series that I love, and I
love little catbugs!

So today we are gonna be making Catbug Peanut
Butter Squares!
Let's get started!

The things you will need, will be: 1/4 Cup of
flour, 1/3 Cup of regular sugar, 1/3 Cup of

brown sugar, 1/3 Cup of peanut butter, you
can either do creamy or chunky peanut butter,
whatever one is your favorite,

3/4s teaspoon of baking soda, 1/2 a teaspoon
of salt, 1/2 a teaspoon of vanilla extract,
and then 20 mini-peanut butter cups!

These are the brand by Reese's, I love these,
they're so good but you're just gonna have

to unwrap all of 'em and I've just put 20
of 'em in this little bowl.

Then you'll need 1 egg and one sh-tick of
butter which is 1/2 Cup of butter.

You'll also need an an additional mixing bowl
and a whisk and a pan. any size that you like,

this one is 11 by 8, and a piece of wax paper,
"Pam" Baking Spray and an electric mixer.

I'm gonna be using my stand-mixer, but you
can just use a hand-mixer OR you could do
it- you could do it manual!
You can hand-whisk it all together!
All right, let's get started!

In a big mixing bowl, you're gonna combine
both your sugars, your butter and your vanilla

extract until things are very light and fluffy
and we're gonna add our egg.

Once this is all mixed up, you're gonna add
your peanut butter!

It's really goopy so you'll probably need
your spatula.
In this bowl you're gonna add all your dry-ingredients
You're gonna add your flour...
BOOOM!
Your salt,
beeewmnn!
And your baking soda
Beeeeew!
Then you're gonna whisk it all together!

Now that you've got your dry-ingredients all
mixed together, we're gonna slowly add it

to our peanut butter mixture until it's all
combined.

Now you're gonna take 20 mini-peanut butter
cups and- I got the Reese's ones, they look

like this- so you're just gonna unwrap all
of 'em and then you're gonna cut ' em in half...
HI-YAH!
Oooh...that actually worked.

And then you're just gonna take the halves
and put 'em in the bowl.

Now you're just gonna mix it for another minute
and then we'll get the pan ready.

Now that we've got our peanut butter square
mixture all ready, you're gonna take your

baking pan and a piece of wax paper or parchment
paper, whatever you have handy, and you're
gonna put it in your tray for easy cleanup...
Like this,

...and you're gonna take a little bit of baking-spray
or butter, whatever you wanna use to grease
your pan.
Spray a little bit in the bottom.
WOOOH!!

All right and now you're just gonna take your
peanut butter mixture and put it in your pan
and flatten it out!

Oooh they smell so good! Smells like Peanut
Butter Heaven!

Now that you've got your peanut butter mixture
in your pan, you're gonna heat your oven to

350 and you're gonna bake for about 17 minutes,
but keep your eye on it!

As soon as the tops start to turn a golden-brown,
it's donnnnnnnne!

"Your mom said to say that I could have...just
one peanut butter square, but not til after
they cooled down!"

"I'm Catbug!" And now we are gonna cut our
peanut butter squares INTO squares!
Oh my gosh, they smell so good!

Ta-daaaaaaa! Here are our Catbug Peanut Butter
Squares!
I hope you guys liked 'em, I loved making something Catbug Themed because I love "Bravest Warriors"!

Again, I'll put a link down below so you can
go check it out, and if you guys have any other
ideas for any other Nerdy Nummies- heeh-hee!-

...please let me know and leave me a comment
down below.

Also I will be posting lots of pictures on
Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter, Instagram so you

can check 'em out there and if you guys make
Catbug Peanutbutter Squares, please send me
some pictures!
I love to re-blog them and post them!

I just get a big kick out of seeing your baking
creations!
All right, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Ooop!
(muffled)Bye-byeee! Hee-hee-ha-ha-heh!
"This is how we bake!"
"This is how we shake!"
"This is how I... Catbug!"
